availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: John Mullins (Covington, Kenton County, Kentucky, laborer and accused murderer.)

body.p: Kenton County, Kentucky, laborer and convict. Ohio native. Son of Rebecca Mullins. Resident of Covington, Kentucky, in 1850. Laborer in Covington in 1860. Convicted of manslaughter for the death of David McCullough in Covington in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington 1st Ward, p. 215A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Kenton County, Covington 3rd Ward, p. 113.
Louisville Journal (Louisville, KY), March 11, 1862, p. 3.
KYR-0001-020-2093.
